page.title: 11PRISTON MILL
page.content: Alongside Priston Mill Farm is an historic cornmill, recorded in the original Domesday survey, and still in commercial use today. The mill is powered by a large waterwheel, fed by the Conygre brook, and mainly used for grinding the farm's wheat into flour, which is then packed and distributed to local grocers and bakers. Today's growing demand for wholewheat flour is keeping the mill in daily use during the summer season. The mill is open to the public at certain times and proving to be a popular tourist attraction, along with the farm shop and small cafe. A joint tour of mill and farm can make an informative and enjoyable day out. The farmer is aiming to increase the tourist aspect of the farm
